newsitem.title: USA: Yankee flurries seen for U.S corporate bond market.
newsitem.headline: Yankee flurries seen for U.S corporate bond market.

text.p: A flurry of activity is expected to hit the corporate bond new issue market with dealers reporting a slew of yankee debt offerings lining up to tap the market.
"We're seeing a lot of names come to market," said one syndicate source. "The pace is definitely picking up...a lot of yankee issuers are expected to tap the market near-term."
The recent dip in U.S. Treasury yields should continue to spur the corporate bond new issue market as corporations capitalize on lower interest rates to finance debt, dealers added.
The following issues are expected to come to market, syndicate sources said.
Union Pacific Resources is expected to price $400 million in A3/A-rated two-part debt consisting of $200 million in 10-year debt and $200 million of 30-year debt.
Loewen Group is expected to price $350 million in a two-part senior guaranteed notes deal consisting of $175 million five-year debt and $175 million seven-year debt via Smith Barney.
Medpartners is also expected to tap the market with $300 million in Baa3/BBB-rated 10-year debt also via Smith Barney.
Conagra is expected to issue $400 million in two-part debt via Smith Barney. The deal is expected to consist of a 30-year bullet and a 30-year with a 10-year put option.
In yankee issues, $1.0 billion in two-part debt is expected to come to market out of Petronas. The deal consist of $500 million each in five and 10-year debt.
Brazil is expected to price $750 million in global debt in a five or ten-year maturity via Chase Securites.
"Everyone is extremely interested in this because Brazil is such a rare Euromarket borrower," said one syndicate manager.
Another $750 million out of Argentina in 10-year global debt is seen being issued soon via Goldman Sachs and Salomon Bros.
Banco Nationale de Paris is also seen tapping the market with $350 million in 10-year subordinated yankee debt out of Salomon Brothers in early October.
Norsk Hydro is expected to tap the market with $250 million in 20-year debt via Morgan Stanley.
Banco Santander is expected to price $150 million in 10-year subordinated yankee notes.
In addition, South Africa is gearing up to launch its first yankee issue ever via Merrill Lynch, sources added.
The South Africa deal is expected to consist of $250 to $300 million of a 10-year maturity.
In other issues, Unisys Corp is expected to price $250 million in eight-year senior notes via Bear Stearns.
Boyd Gaming Corp is expected to price $200 million in seven-year notes via Salomon Brothers. Price talk on the issue is 250 to 275 basis points over Treasuries.
Frontiervision is expected to price $200 million in senior subordinated notes due 2006 via JP Morgan Securities.
Among private placements, Uniforet Inc, RSL Communications and Genesis Health Ventures are all expected to issue 144A debt.
In the government market, the 30-year U.S. Treasury bond is trading off 10/32 at 97-23/32 to yield 6.93 percent.
--Nancy Leinfuss, 212-859-1675
